title: Trust Funds by Ada
description: Creating a Trust is expensive and complicated.As wealth is created in the blockchain ecosystem people will need ways to share and manage it.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge states that creating a Trust is expensive and complicated and as wealth is created in the blockchain ecosystem, people will need ways to share and manage it. The proposal aims to develop a smart contract that implements a financial Trust on the Cardano Network that delegates and distributes your tokens as you describe. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the team working on this project includes the main developer being impressively versed and prepared to follow through with this proposal and a thought-out plan. The plan is separated into a month-by-month timeline that aims to start project development by month 2. Given the information provided, this proposal is likely to succeed.
f6_assessments.q2: Based on the proposal, this project includes sufficient information and milestones to audit the progress of this proposal. With the main deliverables focusing on starting up the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal clearly identifies the general area of challenge however it can benefit from hardening the minimum viable product (mvp). I am a bit unclear about what the core building block will solve. The main challenge of bringing an analog product like traditional trust into digital trustless world should solve the issue of verification of conditions to be satisfied, e.g. someone passing away. Though I am not suggesting that the proposal to outline to solution, I expect a bit more detail on the challenges to overcome in mvp use cases. 

Also, the proposal currently seems to be only discusing the first half of the scenario where ownership is assumed by a trust. It seems to be missing to discuss the second half where the ownership passes on to the heir(s) without which a reasonable mvp cannot be drawn on the napkin. If this is a conscious decision to exclude from the current building block, let's make it explicit for easier assessment.
f6_assessments.q1:
Though I am a big fan of the idea, and RBM.dev's experience and drive, crisp use case(s) that the mvp would solve is the key to knowing when we arrive at a successful conclusion.

As I mentioned in the earlier section, let's crisp up the mvp and understand what use case(s) the first building block will achieve. This can then help us clearly understand what success will look like.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan provided gives us some tasks as a checklist so progress can be somewhat audited but auditability of success will depend on the use case clarification to identify the criteria.

f6_assessments.q0: It is a fantastic proposal and one needed in the crypto space for sure. This could also affect if an individual holder suffers an untimely death and the funds are forever locked in the blockchain, a trust who can support beneficiaries would be an interesting development in Cardano that still doesn't  exist out there in the form of smart contract.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the experience and the passion behind developing with what is learned through the Plutus Pioneer program I say the experience is there but more KPIs needs to be clarified as to how it can be implemented to an average holder or how cna it be used in small scale to the people who will use it.
f6_assessments.q2: I think is good start and needs a bit more defining on how it can be used by the average joe, but the proposer did mention it will work on expanding once the foundation he is trying to resolved is built. The concept is innovative and one that needs attention for all crypto but would be amazing that such leadership is spawn from Cardano first.

solution: A smart contract that implements a financial Trust on the Cardano Network that delegates and distributes your tokens as you describe.
